page.title: 06PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: The Gate Inn was established over 250 years ago. It serves not only as a public house but also as a base for the local Riding Club. The Dog Inn dates from 1520.It retains much of the old-world charm with beams and a low ceiling. The Railway Public House was formerly known as the Railway Hotel. It has a functions room at the rear & an adjoining field. Across the road was a Railway Station which was eventually demolished and replaced by a station near the waterworks. This station was demolished in the late sixties. The Swan was originally a coaching inn. Earlier in the century a fair was held annually on the paddock next to the Swan.
